content.description:
Burly climbing through pockets with big reaches. Have fun figuring out the bouldering on the rope style climbing.

This line starts behind the tree just right of the mouth of the cave. There are three bolt lines that pull onto the low slab here, Echo (left most), Glueless (middle, straight through the bulge), and then Destination Unknown which leaves the slab on its rightmost edge and avoids the meanest part of the bulge. Destination and Glueless share the first bolt. 



8 bolts, fixed anchor with a biner

Techy climbing (echo style, holdless stuff) gets you to the crux. Hold on and send!

Bolts to anchor

Stellar resistance climbing defines this route. This route felt easier for me than many 12cs up at Atlantis due to the lack of any gnarly power cruxes (excepting the roof pull down low... but that's really got nothing on Atlantis). The stone is superlative except for the bottom and a bit in the middle if you stray too far left. 
  
 Start up the choss band and get to a rest before the roof. Execute. Cut your feet. Put them back on and dance your way up the slab weaving between pockets and crimps to a final test of the pump weary at the top.


This route starts just right of the bench where the trail meets the wall and is on the left hand edge of the shallow, right cave at the Cave segment at the Lookout. After 4 bolts, at the roof, the bolt line splits. This line is the left one that goes straight up. 


17 bolts, fixed anchor with a biner

A great jug puller that is only marred by it's forever wetness. Get on it if it's dry!

Right side of the cave, not really inside the cave though.
Bolts to anchor

Climb super jugs to a high first bolt then enjoy your last bolt-to-bolt sequence of holds that face up. After the second bolt it's continuous problem solving - techy footwork and body position dependent holds. No stopper moves or sequences, just cryptic and rather sustained!



The bolt line immediately left of the bench where the trail meets the wall. Look for chalk on the high, left slanting overlaps. There are two bolt lines that are quite close together that go up grey streaks on the headwall, this is the right of the two bolt lines.  

9 bolts, chains with a biner

Not usually considered as part of the lookout proper, the cave is just lower down from the main cliff band that makes up the main lookout area or the new shield area.  
  
 A big cave that is usually wet on many routes. being climbing on generally big or mid sized holds which makes this stiff. No warm ups near it unless you count prospect P1
